awards.title: WebPick of The Day
awards.description:
Samsung SmartThings educates visitors on home automation, suggesting a wide variety of products with which to build an interconnected network of devices. For its site, New York– and Amsterdam–based digital design firm Your Majesty Co. created a site with a future-proof framework, enabling it to feel timeless as more products with smart-home capabilities are released. High-end product images and video content drive the narrative throughout the site, showcasing and explaining the value of products to visitors.

Your Majesty Co. based the site’s CMS on Contentful and built it with CSS, Gulp.js, HTML, Koa 2.0, Node.js, Redis and WebComponents; layered SVG animations on the site were made accessible on all browsers and mobile devices.

awards.title: WebPick of The Day
awards.description: WhitePike.com is a simple yet elegantly designed responsive scrolling site that scales beautifully for tablet and mobile. It uses bold images to communicate the brand world of White Pike

awards.title: One Page Love Design Award
awards.description:
"The White Pike Whiskey Site (whitepike.com) is a vintage-themed One Pager promoting 'White Pike' - a white whiskey, aged for only 18 minutes. The retro imagery in consistent throughout and that centrally-divided drink recipe browser is really impressive."

- One Page Love Judge Panel

awards.title: Special Mentioned/ (4th Place) Interaction Design Competition
awards.description: Next Page is a design competition organized by the Domus Academy in partnership with Conde Nast challenging its participants to design a product (an app, a website service or a digital device) that explores contemporary and future publishing strategies, demonstrates the potentialities of interactive technology in the field. In response to the brief, I proposed the creation of MyMag.

awards.description:
Tasked with bridging Mary Kay and Millenial women, we focused on the brand asset that no other competitor could match, and the consumer insights that no buyer could deny. 

"50 years speak for themselves. Since its foundation, Mary Kay has broken the boundaries between buyer and seller, and has enriched women’s lives with caring and personalized service. Today, Mary Kay takes on the challenge of connecting with a new generation of females that we call the NOW Millennials – females that are Networked, Open-minded, and Worldly"

certifications.name: Business Design, Building a Human-Centered Business

projects.title: Tapsell Launch (Research & Data Analytic Team)
projects.description:
When assigned with the the task of launching Tapsell - a new online student marketplace in UCSD, we soon realized the competitive nature of classified marketplaces, and decided to take a step backward, conduct complex researches in order to get a better understanding our product as well as our targets in order to produce an effective and viable launch.

Given a limited amount of time, “I’d Tap That” Launch is a product of thorough researches with multiple trials, and tests that closely investigate Tapsell and its target users. While our secondary research informs us about Tapsell and its uniqueness in comparison to other successful online student marketplaces, our primary research (surveys, focus groups, experimentations) allows us to take a comprehensive look at consumers’ usages, preferences and interactions among online student marketplaces. These insights will then be deliberately taken into the derivation of Tapsell’s competitive edges which will be broadly advertised and emphasizes before, during and after the launch. 

This final report documents our 3 months of researching, analyzing, brainstorming and executing the I’d Tap That Launch. It consists of our research strategy, our analysis with recommendations for product development as well as brand promotion and most importantly I’d Tap That Launch’s evaluations.

US Team Lead, Customer Success at eduMe

projects.title: National Student Advertising Competition 2013-2014
projects.description:
Client: Mary Kay 
50 years speak for themselves. Since its foundation, Mary Kay has broken the boundaries between buyer and seller, and has enriched women’s lives with caring and personalized service. Today, Mary Kay takes on the challenge of connecting with a new generation of females that we call NOW Millennials – Generation Y females that are Networked, Open-minded, and Worldly. 

Through six months of market research on various platforms, including focus groups, on-site interviews, and online surveys, we identified that the primary disconnect between these NOW Millennials and Mary Kay, was the perception that Mary Kay was not a brand that catered to the millennial generation. After thorough assessment of this problem, our team has conceptualized a solution that will captivate the NOW Millennial, a girl that we’ve identified as a cultural aficionado, a creative innovator, an experience seeker and most of all, a girl who lives in the moment and for the moment.

Based on these observations, our team has crafted the “Make Up Your Moment” campaign - a movement that realizes and embraces how each NOW Millennial defines her moment. In this targeted campaign, traditional advertisements, PR events, and social media will be utilized to shape the persona of the “Mary Kay girl” and help the NOW Millennial imagine, create, document, and share their own “Mary Kay Moments.” We will leverage several creative channels in our campaign, from music and video streaming to mobile applications, in order to be a part of every moment our NOW Millennial interacts with this ever-changing world.

profile_positions.description:
Your Majesty is a strategy-led, design and technology firm that powers brand experiences and digital products for brands like Samsung, Airbnb, Netflix, Los Angeles Lakers, and more. My areas of responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

I. Research, Insights, & Thought Leadership  
II. Brand & Communication Strategy  
III. Innovation & Product/UX Strategy  
IV. Client Services & Business Development 
V. Team & Project Management
profile_positions.title: Strategy Director, Brand Experience & Digital Products
Senior Strategist, Brand Experience & Digital Products

profile_positions.description:
I was part of Ogilvy’s APAC initiative to help FMCG brands like Unilever, Coca Cola, Mondelez, and Kimberly Clark rethink how technology could strengthen their relationships with ‘low-tech’ customers in the Vietnam/SEA region. My responsibilities there included:

— Develop brand content concepts and content journeys to help support brand campaigns year round. 
— Facilitate whiteboard sessions and content sprints with executives to identify editorial opportunities, leading to a new brand platform created for Pond’s. 
— Inform creative and communication planners about emerging technologies and media that reach consumers at the right time and place in their journey.

Select Project: Inspire perception shift for Vietnamese parents 
Milo is a sports chocolate milk for children. To strengthen their brand presence and market share in Vietnam, Milo launched a multi-year initiative—Activ Vietnam—that aimed to change Vietnamese families' perceptions of children leading active lifestyles. I led this project’s behavioral research and helped the brand effectively use creative technologies to reach parents and children beyond traditional ads. 

The program has successfully seized the interest and elicited the support of athletes, education and sports managers, and celebrities who joined to spread the “Activ Vietnam” spirit to the public. More than 320,000 parents have committed to readily take action with Nestlé Milo.
profile_positions.title: Creative Strategist, Emerging Tech

profile_positions.description:
Working between the Innovation & Production teams, my main responsibilities were researching millennials’ behaviors and leveraging technologies to help brands reach new customers.

— Conduct primary/secondary research to guide creativity towards practical goals while protecting strategic integrity.
— Craft brand digital strategy for various corporate websites and platforms with different technologies and CMS platforms. 
— Design the information architecture, wireframe, and flows to illustrate interactive concepts for clients and vendors.
— Perform SEO and Google Analytics audits pre-product launch to establish benchmark and post-launch to optimize.
profile_positions.title: Digital Producer

profile_positions.description:
I conducted monthly SEO and Google Analytics audits, provided optimization recommendations, researched users' behaviors to optimize content placement, and assisted with media planning and writing performance reports for digital campaigns. My other tasks were to:

— Conduct monthly SEO and Google Analytics audits to inform clients and the content team about optimization.
— Create media buying plans for digital campaigns to place digital creative and content at the right channels.
— Research behaviors on different digital devices to optimize mobile media placement and improve UX design.

volunteer_experiences.description: I was involved as a coordinator for the American Cancer Society for their event called, Making Strides Against Breast Cancer in Silicon Valley in 2011 and 2012. It's an annual event help in downtown San Jose, during which breast cancer victims or families of victims participated as runners to raise the awareness about Breast Cancer in the area. As a coordinator, I led more than 100 students from De Anza College in volunteering as security and cheerleading staffs for the runners.

For "Our City Forest" campaign in San Jose, I was the main coordinator between De Anza College students and the organization in several "Tree Planning" and "Park Cleaning" events in the Santa Clara, and San Jose areas. Those events are one of the many efforts from "Our City Forest" to involve students, and local residents in creating a better local environment.

Being on the staff board of the Christmas Shoppe Event at InnVision Shelter, my task was to assist low-income, homeless parents to shop for Christmas gifts for their children. All of the gifts provided were donations from generous and wholehearted donators around the area.
